page.title: 11SPARROWS NEST THEATRE
page.content: The Sparrows Nest Theatre is built upon estate land.The grounds are for public use.You can enter the Sparrows Nest from the High Street or from the Ravine or from Whapload Road.During the Second World War the Sparrows Nest was a gathering place for travellers and a base for hazardous war duties.In the grounds there are two bowling greens and tennis courts.The grounds slope down towards the sea.The gardens are well kept by four council workmen.The Sparrows Nest is going to be discontinued as a theatre .The Marina Cinema has been bought by the Council and is going to be used as a theatre instead.
